item.title: Create a blog in 5 minutes using Hugo, GitHub Pages and Travis CI
item.description: Blog creation Install Hugo Official documentation outlines this step for many operating systems very well. Create a site Open command line and run hugo new site blog Initialize a git repository and create a first commit. git init git commit -m "create a site" Add a theme Hugo has a lots of themes. For example, I use Minimal git submodule add https://github.com/luizdepra/hugo-coder.git themes/minimal After installation, take a look at the exampleSite folder inside themes/minimal.

item.title: About Hugo
item.description: Hugo is a static site engine written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: Cobra Viper J Walter Weatherman Cast Learn more and contribute on GitHub. Setup Some fun facts about Hugo: Built in Go Loosely inspired by Jekyll Primarily developed by spf13 on the train while commuting to and from Manhattan. Coded in Vim using spf13-vim Have questions or suggestions?
